intro: Eriogonum spectabile, commonly known as Spectacle Meadowplant, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a member of the buckwheat family (Polygonaceae) and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It produces small, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, purple, and white. Eriogonum spectabile is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a food source for pollinators.
